intro: Tithymalus cymbifer, commonly known as the purple tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is native to parts of Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Tithymalus cymbifer is often found in meadows and along streambanks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
